info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 30 at 3:18AM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches, with localized amounts up to 3 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For southeast Utah, total snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches in the Abajos and La Sal mountains with 3 to 6 inches along Highway 191. * WHERE...In Utah, La Sal and Abajo Mountains. In Colorado, Uncompahgre Plateau and Dallas Divide, West Elk and Sawatch Mountains and Grand and Battlement Mesas. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops and mountain passes. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
